description.p: Project Marco aims to provide a hosted bookmarks service for multiple users. An initial draft of the requirements are now online.
Added the Project Marco Database Design document.
New XML Technology page, with live newsfeeds!
New layout for dubh.org index page.
Dubh.Org discussion forums are now online at http://talk.dubh.org. More forums will be added over the next few days.
The CVS browser is back online at http://cvs.dubh.org, and has been upgraded to the latest JCVS Servlet.
Verified HTML 4.01 Transitional complience on most Dubh.Org pages and added the verification logo.

Upgraded to XDK 9.0.2.0.0A, Tomcat 3.3 Milestone 3 (both of which are hopefully faster and more stable). Some behind-the-scenes directory reorganization and patched up a couple of security issues (yeah, thanks everyone who noticed the bookmarks util wasn't secure and helpfully notified me by editing my bookmarks :) ).

The "what's new" stuff has been externalized into its own separate XML document, and only the first 3 entries from the changelog are displayed on the index page. The rest are on a separate page. Stylesheets kick ass.

New article added:
Installing Oracle XSQL Servlet on Tomcat 3.3
Added a link to my bookmarks in the navigator (some of these are Oracle internal sites and won't work outside the corporate intranet).
Updated information on JFreeCiv project page. Added some screenshots. Eye candy. Nice.
Added a new screenshot for JFreeCiv.
Replaced Tomcat with OC4J. It truly is a testament to the portability of J2EE that this required practically zero code changes :).
